alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 6:31PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong showers impacting portions of eastern Meigs, Washington, southeastern Athens, Pleasants, western Ritchie, north central Mason, western Tyler, Wirt, northern Jackson and Wood Counties through 700 PM EST... At 630 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Beverly to New Haven. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Sporadic gusty winds in and near these and other showers in the area could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, St. Marys, Beverly, Elizabeth, Middlebourne, Racine, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Ravenswood, Williamstown, Paden City, New Haven, Sistersville, Belmont, Mineralwells, Washington and North Bend State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 146 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 17. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
